c933144f6f.title: I know this well because I have a gift of knowledge.

paragraphs.text: I know this well because I have a gift of knowledge. When I learn something I can easily share it with others and help them apply it. The thing I had to finally stop doing is just what you said: stop getting sucked into everyone else’s play for my money, need for coaching or desire to learn from others rather than myself. I finally leaned into what I…

content.subtitle: Who wants to be a novice that lives in a world of theories and ideas forever? This is surely a call to action, not an attempt to discount…

virtuals.subtitle: Who wants to be a novice that lives in a world of theories and ideas forever? This is surely a call to action, not an attempt to discount…

paragraphs.text: Thank you for this! I think so many of us naturally fall into this category as we tread through what is seemingly unfamiliar territory. With a neverending ocean of information on just about any and every subject, we can end up with information overload while on our quest to research and find the best practices in any arena. I think we do this to…
paragraphs.name: 9c30

2df88c7f1e20.title: Awesome! Hit the nail on the head.

content.subtitle: I admit it, learning is my addiction of choice, and I have to force myself to put it down and “put into action” in order to be effective…

virtuals.subtitle: I admit it, learning is my addiction of choice, and I have to force myself to put it down and “put into action” in order to be effective…

paragraphs.text: Awesome! Hit the nail on the head. :) It’s an easy attraction to get caught up in “always learning but never able to come to the knowledge of truth” (2 Timothy 3:7).
I admit it, learning is my addiction of choice, and I have to force myself to put it down and “put into action” in order to be effective and relevant.
paragraphs.name: 1ecc

paragraphs.text: Loved this article!

d11989c625c1.title: It’s not that learning is useless and we should stop educating ourselves.

paragraphs.text: It’s not that learning is useless and we should stop educating ourselves. There are many situations in which you do need to learn something before attempting it. I believe the problem is decision fatigue by the sheer volume of voices available on every subject. How does one know which is the “best” way? The key point is to stop obsessively…
paragraphs.name: 65ae

813adc4947bc.title: Clear and convicting, but also hopeful.

paragraphs.text: Clear and convicting, but also hopeful. I don’t have to fear that I’m missing out on some secret information. I can learn through action.
paragraphs.name: eb67

paragraphs.text: Well put. I agree.

Surely one must have a few reservations, particularly about “Stop learning by listening, start learning by talking” and “Stop learning by reading, start learning by writing.” Dear me, the person who teaches himself and does all the talking is taught by a poor teacher and is never…

paragraphs.text: I do not agree. All learning is useful — it teaches one how to learn and how to think.
paragraphs.name: 30e5

paragraphs.text: Consider a climber, training in a gym or half-way up a mountain — it makes no difference. Every sequence they climb teaches them a movement, a way of using their muscles in harmony to apply forces downwards, outwards and often upwards …
paragraphs.name: 27cd

9e0a8fe51b1a.title: I’m 100% with you on this one.

paragraphs.text: I’m 100% with you on this one. Learning from someone else’s experience is a double-edge sword. It provides practical info but it can make the path from A to B appear immutable. The means by which one arrive from A to B always differ. You get to understand that when you actually start doing.
paragraphs.name: 087f

paragraphs.text: I think it’s great that humans have a thirst for continuously expanding their knowledge and feed their ever-growing curiosity, but this is only half of the definition of learning. The other half is applying the knowledge and putting it into…
You nailed it! “Stop learning by watching the game. Start learning by playing it.” This is my new mantra. Thanks for the great article Max!
paragraphs.name: 6fc1

64ea39ff392a.title: The learning must be a part of action plan… your article suggests giving up when learning is…

paragraphs.text: The learning must be a part of action plan… your article suggests giving up when learning is difficult and time consuming. Learning needs extreme hardwork and patience… and is part of action itself… your view of learning is superficial…

8475219c412105c390374c73b9dd12ff.title: Why Learning Is A New Procrastination

ae633fe2ec996ffd54a822fab538c36f.title: Why Learning Is A New Procrastination

5edbe907f98c6385919e92d2d813a74e.title: Why Learning Is A New Procrastination

d4075651c12858ae0811b2630566c322.title: Why Learning Is A New Procrastination

dde138d8906b0f8804fa63215217f420.title: Why Learning Is A New Procrastination

paragraphs.text: Embrace the truth. No matter how good your theoretical knowledge is, you will face a lot of obstacles while applying it. You will have to deal with issues that have never been described or covered in any book. You will have to look for the solutions and make the spontaneous decisions that no one probably has ever thought of. You will have to design your own road to success.
Knowledge is worthless unless it is applied.
paragraphs.name: 475f

paragraphs.text: You learn how to write and publish a new book. You learn how to launch a successful blog. You learn how to hit your goal on Kickstarter. You learn how to build the next “unicorn”. You learn how to land a job of your dream. You learn how to successfully sell thousands of items on Amazon. You learn how to make millions of dollars in passive income.
paragraphs.name: 4ff5
